This image humorously highlights a common annoyance with TV shows and movies: the inconsistent volume levels between dialogue and action scenes. On the left, the person is shown trying to increase the volume to hear quiet dialogue, indicating that it's at a low level. On the right, the action scene is suddenly loud, requiring the person to adjust the volume again. 

The satirical aspect comes from the exaggerated depiction of the person actively changing the volume with the remote while simultaneously reacting to the loudness by covering an ear. It's a playful take on the frustration many viewers feel when they have to constantly adjust the volume to maintain a comfortable listening experience.
